content:
According to the spec, this is a recursive query since the target resource type (partof) is of the same type as the base resource type (Organization).
In this case the type is similar to the domain resource type.
/Organization?_include:iterate=Organization:partof&criteria...

Is the following also considered a recursive iteration? Here the domain resource is different (CareTeam).
/CareTeam?_include=CareTeam:participant:Organization&_include:iterate=Organization:partof-target&criteria...
Yes. Organization differs from CareTeam (which is the focus of the search), so one would need :iterate

One followup question. Is the following query considered a recursive one, since CareTeam:participant can also reference a CareTeam resource?
CareTeam?_include=CareTeam:participant&_include:iterate=Patient:general-practitioner

Or should I clearly specify a participant for it to be considered recursive?
CareTeam?_include=CareTeam:participant:CareTeam&_include:iterate=Patient:general-practitioner
I think what you'd want to do is _include:iterate=CareTeam:participant

Yes! I meant _include:iterate=CareTeam:participant... my bad.

So for simplicity, my question was about CareTeam?_include:iterate=CareTeam:participant.

Wanted to verify that a recursive iteration is expected when the target type is not specified.
iterate gets repeatedly called either until there are no more additions or the server decides it's iterated enough (servers are allowed to limit how many layers they go down)
